tooltips.opening: Stock price at the opening of today's trading session. Compare with the previous close to see how the market opened.
tooltips.high: Highest price reached by the stock during the day. Shows the peak of investor optimism.
tooltips.low: Lowest price reached by the stock during the day. Shows the point of greatest pessimism.
tooltips.previousClose: Previous day's closing price. Base for calculating the daily percentage change.
tooltips.volume: Number of shares traded. High volume indicates strong investor interest in the stock.
tooltips.marketCap: Market Value: stock price x total shares. Shows the company's size on the exchange.
tooltips.pl: Price/Earnings: how many years it would take to recover the investment with current earnings. Low P/E (< 15) may indicate a cheap stock, high P/E (> 25) may indicate an expensive stock or growth expectations.
tooltips.dy: Dividend Yield: percentage of the price you receive in dividends per year. Above 6% is considered excellent for passive income.
tooltips.min52: Lowest stock price in the last 12 months. Helps see if the current price is near a historical low.
tooltips.max52: Highest stock price in the last 12 months. Helps see if the current price is near a historical high.
tooltips.range52: Shows where the current price is relative to the last year's price range. Near the minimum may indicate opportunity, near the maximum may indicate caution.
tooltips.score: Score based on various indicators. High score indicates more positive signals for buying.
